Welcome to Brenda Miao Project 3’s documentation!¶

class scripts.NN.NeuralNetwork(sizes, activation='sigmoid', seed=0, alpha=0.1, epsilon=0.001, epochs=250, threshold=0.01)¶

Bases: object

Generic class for a neural network with an arbitrary number of layers and specified activation function

self.epsilon¶

random float to prevent divide by 0 errors self.alpha (float or int) : learning rate of the network self.epochs (int) : number of times to run dataset through model (while loss is above a threshold)

Type

float

self.threshold¶

threshold for stopping when the loss is below this value

Type

float

self.activation¶

specified activation function to use

Type

function

self.dx_activation¶

derivative of specified activation function

Type

function

self.losses¶

list of average loss at each epoch

Type

list<float>

self.z_values¶

list to store pre-activation values at each layer to make backpropagation calculations easier

Type

list<np.array>

self.layers¶

list of vectors containing input/activation values at each layer

Type

list<np.array>

self.bias¶

list of biases for each layer of the network

Type

list<float>

self.weights¶

list of weights between each layer of the network

Type

list<np.ndarray>

Parameters

  • sizes (list<int>) – the number of nodes at each layer (architecture of notebook), stored as self.layers

  • activation (str) – “sigmoid” or “ReLU” to specify which activation function should be used, default=”sigmoid”

  • seed (int) – seed to set for numpy.random, use None for random seed, default=0

  • alpha (float) – learning rate, stored as self.alpha, default=0.1

  • epsilon (float) – small number to avoid divide by zeros, stored as self.epsilon, default=0.001

  • epochs (int) – max number of epochs to run, stored as self.epochs, default=250

static _sigmoid(x)¶

Sigmoid activation function

static _dxSigmoid(x)¶

Derivative of the sigmoid activation function

static _ReLU(x)¶

ReLU activation function

static _dxReLU(x)¶

Derivative of the ReLU function

forward(values)¶

Propagates input values through the network, and sets the values of each layer to the activation of the previous layer

Parameters

values (np.ndarray) – array containing values in sample x feature format

backpropagate(y)¶

Perform backpropagation to update the weights and bias of the network

Parameters

y (np.array) – array containing ground truth values for error calculations

fit(test_x, test_y)¶

Trains the network using feedforward and backpropagation

Parameters

  • test_x (np.ndarray) – array containing values in sample x feature format

  • test_y (np.ndarray) – array of ground truth values for each sample in text_x

predict(test_values)¶

Fits a trained network to a new set of values

Parameters

test_values (np.ndarray) – array containing values in sample x feature format

scripts.NN.encode(fasta)¶

One-hot encoding of nucleotide sequences

Parameters

fasta (str) – nucleotide sequence to be one-hot encoded

Returns

one-hot and flattened vector encoding input fasta sequence

Return type

np.array

scripts.NN.read_fasta(input_file)¶

Parses fasta file to retrieve a list of fasta sequence

Parameters

  • input_file (str, path-like) – Path to fasta file to be read in. Fasta file can contain list of sequences with or without fasta headers

  • Returns – list : list of sequences extracted from fasta file

scripts.NN.kfold(k, x_val, y_val, seed=None, quiet=True, **nn_params)¶

Split the training set into k random folds by shuffling then splitting the dataset into k folds

Parameters

  • x_val (np.ndarray) – array containing values in sample x feature format

  • y_val (np.ndarray) – array of ground truth values for each sample in x_val

  • seed (int) – whether to set random seed for random sampling, default=None

  • quiet (bool) – whether to print losses for each fold, default=False

  • **nn_params (dict) – dictionary of parameters to initialize the Neural Network to be initialized

Returns

average AUC calculated across the folds

Return type

float

scripts.NN.geneticAlgo(params, x_vals, y_vals, model=<class 'scripts.NN.NeuralNetwork'>, k=7, max_iter=5)¶

Split the training set into k random folds by shuffling then splitting the dataset into k folds

Parameters

  • params (list<list>) – list of parameters to test for, each parameter should have order “size, activation, alpha, epochs”

  • x_vals (np.ndarray) – array containing values in sample x feature format

  • y_vals (np.ndarray) – array of ground truth values for each sample in x_vals

  • model (Model object) – type of model to use for testing, default=NeuralNetwork

  • k (int) – number of folds to use for k-fold validation, default=7

  • max_iter (int) – number of iterations to run genetic algorithm for

Returns

list of parameters from the best model selected in the genetic algorithm

Return type

list
